meanings.definition: The quality of being brave or courageous.
meanings.sent1: Her valiancy in facing her fears inspired others to be brave.
meanings.sent2: His valiancy on the battlefield earned him the respect of his comrades.
meanings.sent3: Despite her small size, her valiancy in protecting her friends was unmatched.
meanings.sent4: The valiancy of the firefighters rushing into the burning building was truly heroic.
meanings.sent5: The knight's valiancy in defending the kingdom was legendary.

meanings.definition: The act of showing courage or bravery.
meanings.sent1: The soldier's valiancy in the face of danger saved his fellow troops.
meanings.sent2: The valiancy displayed by the rescue team during the storm was commendable.
meanings.sent3: The valiancy of the cat trying to catch a laser pointer entertained the children.
meanings.sent4: Her valiancy in speaking up for what is right made a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The valiancy of the young boy standing up to the bully was admirable.
